==Events==
* [[489]] &ndash; [[Battle of Verona (489)|Battle of Verona]]: The [[Ostrogoths]] under king [[Theodoric the Great]] defeat the forces of [[Odoacer]] for the second time at [[Verona]] ([[Northern Italy]]). 
* [[737]] &ndash; [[Battle of the Baggage]]: [[Turgesh]] drive back an [[Umayyad]] invasion of [[Khuttal]], follow them south of the [[Oxus]] and capture their [[baggage train]].
*[[1399]] &ndash; [[Henry IV of England|Henry IV]] is proclaimed [[King of England]].
*[[1541]] &ndash; Spanish conquistador [[Hernando de Soto]] and his forces enter [[Tula people|Tula]] territory in present-day western [[Arkansas]], encountering fierce resistance.
*[[1744]] &ndash; [[France]] and [[Spain]] defeat the [[Kingdom of Sardinia]] at the [[Battle of Madonna dell'Olmo]].
*[[1791]] &ndash; The first performance of ''[[The Magic Flute]]'', the last opera by [[Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart|Mozart]] to make its debut, took place at [[Freihaus-Theater auf der Wieden]] in [[Vienna]], [[Austria]].
*  1791   &ndash; The [[National Constituent Assembly]] in [[Paris]] is dissolved; Parisians hail [[Maximilien Robespierre]] and [[Jérôme Pétion]] as "incorruptible patriots".
*[[1813]] &ndash; Battle of Bárbula: [[Simón Bolívar]] defeats [[Santiago Bobadilla]].
*[[1860]] &ndash; Britain's first [[tram]] service begins in [[Birkenhead]], [[Merseyside]].
*[[1882]] &ndash; [[Thomas Edison]]'s first commercial [[hydroelectric]] power plant (later known as [[Vulcan Street Plant|Appleton Edison Light Company]]) begins operation on the [[Fox River (Wisconsin)|Fox River]] in [[Appleton, Wisconsin|Appleton]], [[Wisconsin]], [[United States]].
*[[1888]] &ndash; [[Jack the Ripper]] kills his third and fourth victims, [[Elizabeth Stride]] and [[Catherine Eddowes]].
*[[1895]] &ndash; [[Madagascar]] becomes a [[France|French]] protectorate.
*[[1903]] &ndash; The new [[Gresham's School]] is officially opened by [[Evelyn Wood (British Army officer)|Field Marshal Sir Evelyn Wood]].
*[[1906]] &ndash; The [[Real Academia Galega]], [[Galicia (Spain)|Galician]] [[Galician language|language]]'s biggest linguistic authority, starts working in [[Havana]].
*[[1907]] &ndash; [[McKinley National Memorial]], the final resting place of assassinated U.S. President [[William McKinley]] and his family, is dedicated in [[Canton, Ohio]].
*[[1927]] &ndash; [[Babe Ruth]] becomes the first baseball player to hit 60 home runs in a season.
*[[1931]] &ndash; Start of [[Voortrekkers (youth organization)|"Die Voortrekkers"]] youth movement for [[Afrikaner]]s in [[Bloemfontein]], [[South Africa]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; The [[Hoover Dam]], astride the border between the [[U.S. state]]s of [[Arizona]] and [[Nevada]], is dedicated.
*[[1938]] &ndash; At 2:00 am, [[United Kingdom|Britain]], [[France]], [[Germany]] and [[Italy]] sign the [[Munich Agreement]], allowing [[Germany]] to occupy the [[Sudetenland]] region of [[Czechoslovakia]].
*  1938   &ndash; The [[League of Nations]] unanimously outlaws "intentional bombings of civilian populations".
*[[1939]] &ndash; General [[Władysław Sikorski]] becomes [[commander-in-chief]] of the [[Poland|Polish Government]] in exile.
*  1939   &ndash; [[NBC]] broadcasts the [[first televised American football game]] between the [[Waynesburg Yellow Jackets]] and the [[Fordham Rams]]. Fordham won the game 34-7.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[The Holocaust|Holocaust]] in [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]]: [[Germany|German]] [[Einsatzgruppe]] C complete [[Babi Yar]] massacre.
*[[1945]] &ndash; The [[Bourne End rail crash]], in [[Hertfordshire]], [[England]], kills 43
*[[1947]] &ndash; The [[Islamic Republic of Pakistan]] and [[Yemen]] join the [[United Nations]].
*  1947   &ndash; The [[World Series]], featuring the [[New York Yankees]] and the [[Brooklyn Dodgers]], is [[television|televised]] for the first time.
*[[1949]] &ndash; The [[Berlin Airlift]] ends.
*[[1954]] &ndash; The [[U.S. Navy]] [[submarine]] {{USS|Nautilus|SSN-571|6}} is commissioned as the world's first [[nuclear reactor]] powered vessel.
*[[1955]] &ndash; Film star [[James Dean]] dies in a road accident aged 24.
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Mexican-American]] labor leader [[César Chávez]] founds the National Farm Workers Association, which later becomes [[United Farm Workers]].
*  1962   &ndash; [[James Meredith]] enters the [[University of Mississippi]], defying [[Racial segregation|segregation]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; The [[Lockheed L-100]], the civilian version of the [[C-130 Hercules]], is introduced.
*  1965   &ndash; The [[30 September Movement]] attempts a ''coup'' against the [[Indonesia]]n government, which is crushed by the military under [[Suharto]] and leads to [[Indonesian killings of 1965–1966|a mass anti-communist purge]], with over 500,000 people killed.
*[[1966]] &ndash; The [[United Kingdom|British]] [[protectorate]] of [[Bechuanaland Protectorate|Bechuanaland]] declares its independence, and becomes the [[Botswana|Republic of Botswana]]. [[Seretse Khama]] takes office as the first [[Heads of state of Botswana|President]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[BBC]] [[BBC Light Programme|Light Programme]], [[BBC Third Programme|Third Programme]] and [[BBC Home Service|Home Service]] are replaced with [[BBC Radio]] [[BBC Radio 2|2]], [[BBC Radio 3|3]] and [[BBC Radio 4|4]] Respectively, [[BBC Radio 1]] is also launched with [[Tony Blackburn]] presenting its first show.
*[[1968]] &ndash; The [[Boeing 747]] is rolled out and shown to the public for the first time at the [[Boeing Everett Factory]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Jordan]] makes a deal with the [[Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine]] (PFLP) for the release of the remaining hostages from the [[Dawson's Field hijackings]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Roberto Clemente]] records the 3,000th and final hit of his career.
*[[1975]] &ndash; The [[Hughes Helicopters|Hughes]] (later [[McDonnell-Douglas]], now [[Boeing]]) [[AH-64 Apache]] makes its first flight.
*[[1977]] &ndash; Because of US budget cuts and dwindling power reserves, the [[Apollo]] program's [[ALSEP]] experiment packages left on the [[Moon]] are shut down.
*[[1979]] &ndash; The [[Hong Kong]] [[MTR]] commences service with the opening of its [[Kwun Tong Line (MTR)|Modified Initial System]] (aka. [[Kwun Tong Line]]).
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[Ethernet]] specifications are published by [[Xerox]] working with [[Intel]] and [[Digital Equipment Corporation]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Cyanide]]-laced [[Tylenol]] [[1982 Chicago Tylenol murders|kills six people]] in the [[Chicago]] area. Seven are killed in all.
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[Mordechai Vanunu]], who revealed details of Israel's covert nuclear program to British media, is kidnapped in Rome, Italy by the Israeli [[Mossad]].
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[Al Holbert]] was fatally injured when his privately owned propeller driven [[Piper Aerostar|Piper PA-60]] aircraft crashed shortly after takeoff near [[Columbus, Ohio]] when a clamshell door was not closed.
*[[1990]] &ndash; The [[Tenzin Gyatso, 14th Dalai Lama|Dalai Lama]] unveils the [[Canadian Tribute to Human Rights]] in [[Canada]]'s capital city of [[Ottawa]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; An earthquake hits [[India]]'s Latur and Osmanabad district of Marathwada ([[Aurangabad District, Maharashtra|Aurangabad]] division) in [[Maharashtra]] state leaving tens of thousands of people dead and many more homeless.
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Aldwych tube station]] (originally Strand Station) of the [[London Underground]] closes after eighty-eight years in service.
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Ongar railway station]], the furthest [[London Underground]] from Central London, closes.
*[[1996]] &ndash; The [[United States Congress]] passes an Amendment that bars the possession of [[firearm]]s for people who were convicted of [[domestic violence]], even [[misdemeanor]] level.
*[[1999]] &ndash; Japan's second worst nuclear accident at a uranium reprocessing facility in [[Tōkai, Ibaraki|Tōkai-mura]], northeast of [[Tokyo]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; The first images of a live [[giant squid]] in its natural habitat are taken 600 miles south of [[Tokyo]].
*  2004   &ndash; The [[AIM-54 Phoenix]], the primary missile for the [[F-14 Tomcat]], is retired from service. Almost two years later, the Tomcat is retired.
*[[2005]] &ndash; The [[Jyllands-Posten Muhammad cartoons controversy|controversial drawings of Muhammad]] are printed in the [[Denmark|Danish]] newspaper [[Jyllands-Posten]].
*[[2009]] &ndash; The [[2009 Sumatra earthquakes]] occur, killing over 1,115 people.
